whatIsEmf.title: What are Electromagnetic Fields?
whatIsEmf.description: Electromagnetic fields (EMF) are a combination of invisible electric and magnetic fields of force. They are generated by natural phenomena like the Earth's magnetic field but also by human activities, particularly the use of electronic devices and electrical power.

standards.title: Safety Standards
standards.description: International organizations have established safety guidelines for EMF exposure. These guidelines are based on scientific research and include large safety margins.

effects.title: Health Effects
effects.description: According to the World Health Organization (WHO), current evidence does not confirm the existence of any health consequences from exposure to low-level electromagnetic fields. However, research on this topic continues.

questions.question: Are mobile phones safe?
questions.answer: According to current scientific evidence, mobile phones operating within the international guidelines do not produce adverse health effects. If concerned, you can limit exposure by using hands-free devices or texting.

questions.question: What is the difference between ionizing and non-ionizing radiation?
questions.answer: Ionizing radiation (like X-rays) has enough energy to remove electrons from atoms, which can damage DNA. Non-ionizing radiation (like radio waves, microwaves, and the EMF from power lines) doesn't have enough energy to remove electrons from atoms.

questions.question: How are EMF levels measured?
questions.answer: EMF levels are typically measured using specialized equipment like spectrum analyzers and field strength meters. The units of measurement are volts per meter (V/m) for electric fields and amperes per meter (A/m) or tesla (T) for magnetic fields.

legalRegulations.title: Legal Regulations
legalRegulations.description: This section provides information about international and national regulations regarding electromagnetic field exposure limits and monitoring requirements.

international.title: International Standards
international.description: International organizations have established guidelines for limiting exposure to electromagnetic fields.

eu.title: European Union Regulations
eu.description: The European Union has adopted several directives and recommendations regarding EMF exposure.

national.title: National Regulations
national.description: National regulations implement and sometimes extend international and EU standards.
